name: MyTutor
slogan: One-to-one online tuition with high-performing university students
description:
MyTutor is the UK’s leading platform for online tuition, and we’re on a mission to empower each learner with the expertise they need to reach their potential. Through our highly-engaged tutor community and interactive Online Lesson Space, we envision a future where any student can access high quality one-to-one support.

With the growing demand for personalised education, tutoring has become a £2bn market in the UK alone. Against this backdrop, MyTutor has become one of the fastest-growing and best-funded EdTech businesses in Europe. To date, we’ve worked with over 20,000 families, 400 schools and raised over £10m from a mix of respected institutional and angel investors.

We’re a fun and passionate team of 40 in a shared office in Shoreditch. Our diverse team have previously worked at GoCardless, Lyst, Goldman Sachs, TeachFirst and BCG. As a whole we’re proactive, close-knit and easy to get along with.

team.title: Managing Director, Schools
team.name: James Grant
team.bioHtml: Co-founder at MyTutor - revolutionising one-to-one tuition.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Bertie Hubbard
team.bioHtml: Founder MyTutor • Worked at @Goldman Sachs, @Partners Capital • Studied at @Durham University

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer (Perm)
jobs.description:
Description

MyTutor is on a mission to make life-changing one-to-one learning more accessible. Our use of data, including a matching algorithm driven by machine learning, helps us to optimise education matches based on personality, aspirations and areas of expertise.

Our current tech stack is a Java/MySQL backend hosted in AWS. Our front end is transitioning to React.js. We are 50+ people (and growing) in a bright open plan office in the heart of Shoreditch close to Spitalfields market and Brick Lane.

We’re looking for an experienced Devops engineer with AWS cloud computing experience to support the local development team with deployment pipeline improvements. Being curious about and comfortable with complex code transition is essential to this role, as is being language agnostic.

Responsibilities

- Apply cloud/AWS computing skills to deploy upgrades and fixes
- Design, develop and maintain cloud computing infrastructure (AWS)
- Release of software to test and production environments.
- Supporting the tech team in releasing software to test and production environments.
- Maintenance of code repository (e.g. GitHub)
- Creation and maintenance of continuous integration (QA automation on code commits) & continuous delivery pipelines (automated releases) to both existing servers and microservice architectures.
- Analyse and update test architecture to be as cost-effective and performant as possible (e.g. reserved instances vs. on demand vs. spot instance).
- Support the tech team in provisioning new environments for testing and development, ensuring the solutions are easy to instigate and cost-effective to use.
- Working with the tech team to automate processes wherever possible.
- Working with the tech team on cloud-based software architecture design to better use existing AWS functionality and reduce DIY code.
- Day to day support and maintenance of production infrastructure for security, reliability, performance, cost and scalability
- Providing production support on a rota
- Provisioning of production infrastructure as the business scales, both up and down.
- Active performance monitor and configuration of alerting

Skills you may already have

- You have 5+ years experience as a DevOps Engineer or equivalent software-engineering role.
- You have been a tech lead before in your area of expertise
Solid experience with AWS (3+ years) - CloudFormation, CodePipeline, RDS, EC2, CloudFront, SNS, SQS
- Infrastructure-as-code and automating the heck out of everything is your philosophy
- You possess mentoring experience with specific examples
- Experience with J2EE production systems and applications servers (maybe JBoss/ Wildfly)
- You have experience in network, server, and application-status monitoring.
- Familiarity with development in Java-based backend microservice or serverless technologies (Spring Boot, AWS Lambda, etc)
- Experience with integration tools: Bitbucket, GIT, Bamboo, Jenkins, CodePipeline, DroneCI, Docker etc.
- You can work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.


Benefits

Work in an always learning organisation
Ability to influence the technology stack and engineering practices in the direction you want
Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
A bright open plan office in the heart of shoreditch close to a vibe of spitalfield market and brick lane
Tuesday Breakfasts, Team lunches, Friday socials and regular team events & outings
25 days holiday (plus public holidays)
Cycle to Work scheme and tech acquisition schemes
A flexible work-from-home policy and option for flexible working hours
Pension according to statutory requirements - at a 3% employer and 5% employee rate


MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer (Perm)
jobs.description:
MyTutor is on a mission to make life-changing one-to-one learning more accessible. Our use of data, including a matching algorithm driven by machine learning, helps us to optimise education matches based on personality, aspirations and areas of expertise.

Our current tech stack is a Java/MySQL backend hosted in AWS. Our front end is transitioning to React.js. We are 50+ people (and growing) in a bright open plan office in the heart of Shoreditch close to Spitalfields market and Brick Lane.

We’re looking for an experienced software engineer with Java microservice back end software development experience to help us create a scalable components/apps/microservices based architecture. Being curious about and comfortable with complex code transition is essential to this role, as is being language agnostic.

Skills you may already have

- Experience working as a software engineer in a high-paced, high-change environment
- Experience with J2EE systems (Java Core, Hibernate, JPA, Liquibase, web app servers - JBoss/ Wildfly)
- Experience with integration tools: Bitbucket, GIT, Bamboo, Jenkins, DroneCI, Docker etc.
- Experience with cloud computing (AWS, Google Cloud)
- Some experience with  relational or NoSQL database development (MySQL, Mongo, ElasticSearch, etc)
- Familiarity with development in Java-based backend microservice or serverless technologies (Spring Boot, Drop Wizard, AWS Lambda, etc)
- Comfortable working in an environment aiming to be agile Scrum
- Experience working with inherited codebases and creating entirely new greenfield projects

Responsibilities

Build new product functionality 
Implement new backend according to our tech strategy
Work with Product Owners to refine stories and explore technology challenges with them early
Research new technologies, methodologies and ideas that can improve the organisation
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle
Build good relationships with key stakeholders, who embrace challenges to their requirements and develop an understanding of the technology these relate to
Contribute constructively in improving agile practices

Benefits

Work in an always learning organisation
Ability to influence the technology stack and engineering practices in the direction you want
Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
A bright open plan office in the heart of shoreditch close to a vibe of spitalfield market and brick lane
Tuesday Breakfasts, Team lunches, Friday socials and regular team events & outings
25 days holiday (plus public holidays)
Cycle to Work scheme and tech acquisition schemes
A flexible work-from-home policy and option for flexible working hours
Pension according to statutory requirements - at a 3% employer and 5% employee rate
